text:
Svidrigaïlov studied Raskolnikov closely. 

“Interesting, isn’t it?” he said, a smirk in his eyes. 

“Marfa Petrovna told Avdotya Romanovna about me. 

I might seem romantic to some. 

She felt pity for me, a lost soul. 

When a girl’s heart is moved to pity, it’s dangerous. 

She wants to save him, to lift him up. 

I saw her flying into her own cage. 

“Do you frown, Rodion Romanovitch?” 

“Don’t worry. It all ended in smoke.” 

He sighed, taking another drink. 

“I wish Avdotya had lived in the second century. 

She would have smiled through her martyrdom.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Svidrigaïlov reflects on the dangerous allure of pity and the potential for manipulation in relationships, particularly regarding Avdotya Romanovna.
